what: Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
title: Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
text: goal MoHReportR provide easy use templates (colours, themes, Rmarkdown) MoH related work using R.

title: Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
text: moh_colours function return NSW government branding colours. Note: 10 colours can chosen error thrown requested (can choose colour multiple times though).  scale_fill_moh scale_colour_moh can used ggplot2. vigilant number groups input can 10.
code: # show colours and names moh_colours(show_colours = T) # Return all colours moh_colours() #>  [1] "#002664" "#D7153A" "#00ABE6" "#0A7CB9" "#BFBFBF" "#4F4F4F" "#000000" #>  [8] "#F9BE00" "#FF7F2F" "#752F8A"  # Return first 4 colours moh_colours(1:4) #> [1] "#002664" "#D7153A" "#00ABE6" "#0A7CB9"  # Return colours by name (see show_colours) moh_colours(c('darkBlue', 'red'))  #> [1] "#002664" "#D7153A"  # Multiple colours moh_colours(c(1,1,2,2)) #> [1] "#002664" "#002664" "#D7153A" "#D7153A" moh_colours(1:11) #> Error in moh_colours(1:11): Selected colour indicies can only be between 1 and 10. library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data.frame(names = LETTERS[1:10],                   vals = rep(1, 10)),        aes(x = names, y = vals, fill = names)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_moh() +   theme_void() ggplot(data.frame(names = LETTERS[1:10],                   vals = rep(1, 10)),        aes(x = names, y = vals, colour = names)) +   geom_col(size = 3, fill = 'white') +   scale_colour_moh() +   theme_void() # 11 groups ggplot(data.frame(names = LETTERS[1:11],                   vals = rep(1, 10)),        aes(x = names, y = vals, fill = names)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_moh() +   theme_void() #> Error in data.frame(names = LETTERS[1:11], vals = rep(1, 10)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 11, 10

title: Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
Reporting Paraphernalia For MoH Documents Generated With R
text: MoHReportR provides R markdown template uses NSW Government branding styles (https://www.nsw.gov.au/branding). includes Montserrat font corporate logo. installation, able select MoH templates file menu. open R Markdown template MoHReportR package. Knit document see template output. template screenshot
code: File > New File > R Markdown > From Template

NSW goverment branding colours — moh_colours
text: ... Integer characters vector. See details show_colours Boolean. TRUE barplot colours names shown

title: NSW goverment branding colours — moh_colours
text: can use indicies select colours, colour names . Use moh_colours(show_colours = T) see available

title: NSW goverment branding colours — moh_colours
code: # show colours and names moh_colours(show_colours = TRUE)   # Return all colours moh_colours() # all ten colours #>  [1] "#002664" "#D7153A" "#00ABE6" "#0A7CB9" "#BFBFBF" "#4F4F4F" "#000000" #>  [8] "#F9BE00" "#FF7F2F" "#752F8A"  # Return first 4 colours moh_colours(1:4) # first 4 colours #> [1] "#002664" "#D7153A" "#00ABE6" "#0A7CB9"  # Return colours by name moh_colours(c('darkBlue', 'red')) # colours by name () #> [1] "#002664" "#D7153A"

title: NSW goverment branding colour scale for ggplot2 — moh_ggplot
NSW goverment branding colour scale for ggplot2 — moh_ggplot
text: scale_fill_moh(): Scale fill scale_colour_moh(): Scale color

title: NSW goverment branding colour scale for ggplot2 — moh_ggplot
code: require(ggplot2)  ggplot(  data.frame(    names = c('darkBlue', 'red', 'lightBlue',              'medBlue', 'lightGrey', 'darkGrey',              'black', 'yellow', 'orange', 'purple'),    vals = rep(1,10)),  aes(x = names, y = vals, fill = names)) +  geom_col() +  scale_fill_moh() +  theme_void()   ggplot(  data.frame(    names = c('darkBlue', 'red', 'lightBlue',              'medBlue', 'lightGrey', 'darkGrey',              'black', 'yellow', 'orange', 'purple'),    vals = rep(1,10)),  aes(x = names, y = vals, colour = names)) +  geom_col(size = 3, fill = 'white') +  scale_colour_moh() +  theme_void()
